page.title: 06Charney Bassett village
page.content: Charney Bassett is a small village with about 80 dwellings, and a population of 250. Around the village green are old white-walled thatched cottages, but elsewhere are several modern houses. There is one public house "The Chequers" - built in red-brick. New Road has a row of attractive Gothic-style buildings. There are no street lights and no speed limit. Charney Manor is of great interest, being owned by Quakers and used as a retreat & conference centre. Listed Buildings include the Thatched barn on the green, and the Rectory. There are very few amenities but there are the Public House, the Post Office/Shop open 2 1/2 days a week, a mobile greengrocer alternate weeks, a garage, children's playing field, post & telephone boxes and a bus shelter for the occasional public transport.
